page.title: 05GATESHEAD: TRANSPORT
page.content: Most of the main roads run in a north/south direction. The major road is the A6127, formerly the A1, Great North Road. It runs from the A1(M) through to Newcastle. Heavy vehicles are not supposed to travel North on this road. A new road intersection is being built in the South-West, on the Western By-pass which takes traffic away from the centre of Gateshead. The main bus services in the area also follow a N/S direction, with the E/W routes being covered infrequently. Due to the type of area and road network, cars are by far the greatest form of transport used. There are six petrol filling stations along the A1627 alone. The main London to Newcastle railway runs along the West side. Low Fell station is no longer used.There are no waterways in the area.
